required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate Sperm Parameters in Men With Secondary Hypogonadism Previously Treated With Topical Testosterone
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Open-Label, Fixed Dose, Active-Control, Multi-Center Phase IIB Study to Evaluate Fertility in Men With Secondary Hypogonadism, Comparing Androxal® to a Topical Testosterone in Men Previously Treated With Topical Testosterone.

brief_summary.textblock: The study was designed to determine if Androxal® would affect sperm parameters (count, concentration, volume) in men with secondary hypogonadism who have been previously treated with topical testosterone.

detailed_description.textblock: The study was designed to determine if Androxal® would affect sperm parameters (count, concentration, volume) in men with secondary hypogonadism who have been previously treated with topical testosterone. A maximum of twelve subjects per group were randomized to daily treatments of Androxal® or topical testosterone (Testim®) for six months. The protocol was later amended to include a treatment group who received Androxal after a 3 month wash out period.

primary_outcome.description: Motile total sperm count was measured.

arm_group.description: 1 capsule daily for 6 months of 25 mg of Androxal in men without a 3 month wash out period
Testim 1% Gel applied topically for 6 months
1 x 25 mg Androxal capsule daily for 6 months in men with a previous 3 month washout period of topical testosterone

intervention.description: 25 mg Androxal capsules, 1 capsule daily for 6 months
Testim 1% gel, dosage to be titrated according to manufacturer's instructions, once daily for 6 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult males between 21 and 60 years of age who have been diagnosed with AIHH.
- Subjects must have been treated with a topical testosterone replacement therapy (typically AndroGel® or Testim®) for at least 6 months at enrollment and for not more than 2 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of idiopathic infertility due to primary hypogonadism, testicular failure, Kallmann's syndrome or any other infertility condition.
- Subjects demonstrating any clinically significant medical condition rendering the subjects infertile or marginally fertile other than AIHH.
- Men with a history of, known, or suspected prostate disease not ruled out by a prostate biopsy, or a prostate specific antigen (PSA)>3.6 or clinical suspicion of current prostate disease.
- Men with a hematocrit in excess of 50 % or hemoglobin >17 g/dl

group.title: Group A Testim (Topical Testosterone)
group.description: 1% Testim gel applied once daily

group.title: Group B Androxal no Washout
group.description: 25 mg Androxal capsules once daily in men who have not previously washed out topical testosterone

group.title: Group C Androxal With Wash Out
group.description: 25 mg capsules once daily in men who have previously had a 3 month wash out of topical testosterone

group.title: Group A Testim
group.description: 1% Testim gel applied daily

group.title: Group B Androxal no Wash Out
group.description: 25 mg Androxal 1 capsule per day in men who have not previously washed out topical testosterone for 3 months

group.title: Group C Androxal Wash Out
group.description: 25 mg 1 capsule per day in men who have undergone a 3 month wash out period of topical testosterone

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Sperm Concentration
outcome.population: Subjects in Group A and B who completed the study. No analysis was performed for subjects in Group C because only 1 subject completed the study.

group.description: 1% Testim gel applied daily
